item.text: The next few questions ask about social factors that may help select the right treatment for you. This part will require about 2 minutes

code.display: How tall are you? Enter feet here and inches in the next question. For example, for 5 feet and 6 inches, please anwser 5 feet in this question and 6 inches in the next question)

item.text: How tall are you? Enter feet here and inches in the next question. For example, for 5 feet and 6 inches, please anwser 5 feet in this question and 6 inches in the next question)

Height is used to calculate BMI (body mass index). BMI can help select the right treatment for you. The question was developed by the National
 Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results 
 of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: What is your height? (enter inches here)

item.text: What is your height? (enter inches here)

Height is used to calculate BMI (body mass index). BMI can help select the right treatment for you. The question was developed 
by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if 
results of research on back pain apply to you.
What is your weight? (pounds)

Weight is used to calculate BMI (body mass index). BMI can help select the right treatment for you. The question was developed by
 the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine 
 if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: How would you describe your cigarette smoking?

item.text: How would you describe your cigarette smoking?

valueCoding.display: Used to smoke, but have now quit

item.text: Smoking can affect pain severity and also help choose the right treatment. The question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you drunk or used drugs more than you meant to?

item.text: Have you drunk or used drugs more than you meant to?

Alcohol use can influence risks of different treatments. The question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you felt you wanted or needed to cut down on your drinking or drug use?

item.text: Have you felt you wanted or needed to cut down on your drinking or drug use?

Alcohol use can influence risks of different treatments. The question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.
Employment Status:

Work status is predicitive of outcomes. The question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Select the highest education level attained

item.text: Select the highest education level attained

Education level is predicitive of outcomes. The question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Choose the race with which you most closely identify

item.text: Choose the race with which you most closely identify

Race can be predicitive of outcomes. It can be associated to certain diagnoses and outcomes. The question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Choose the ethnicity with which you most closely identify

item.text: Choose the ethnicity with which you most closely identify

Ethnicity may be predicitive of outcomes. It can be associated to certain diagnoses and outcomes. The question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

valueExpression.name: any_questions_answered
valueExpression.expression: %sc1_value.exists() or %sc2_value.exists() or %sc3_value.exists() or %sc4_value.exists() or %sc5_value.exists() or %sc6_value.exists() or %sc7_value.exists() or %sc8_value.exists() or %sc9_value.exists() or %sc10_value.exists()

iif(%any_questions_answered, iif(%sc1_value.exists(), %sc1_value, 0) + iif(%sc2_value.exists(), %sc2_value, 0) + iif(%sc3_value.exists(), %sc3_value, 0) + iif(%sc4_value.exists(), %sc4_value, 0) + iif(%sc5_value.exists(), %sc5_value, 0) + iif(%sc6_value.exists(), %sc6_value, 0) + iif(%sc7_value.exists(), %sc7_value, 0) + iif(%sc8_value.exists(), %sc8_value, 0) + iif(%sc9_value.exists(), %sc9_value, 0) + iif(%sc10_value.exists(), %sc10_value, 0), {})

item.text: Social Factors Score
